intro: Rubus trinitatis, commonly known as the Trinidad raspberry, is a species of bramble native to the Caribbean island of Trinidad. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, typical of the Rubus genus. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or yellow in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
